availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Carroll County, Kentucky, farmer. Indiana native. Married Mary Ann Bates. Father of Leah S. Bates, Mahala Bates, America Bates, Otis Bates, and Mary Bates. Owned six enslaved people in Carroll County in 1850. Farmer in Carroll County in 1860. Owned twelve enslaved people in Carroll County in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Carroll County, District No. 2; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carroll County, Mill Creek Magisterial District, District No. 1, p. 63; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Carroll County, Mill Creek Magisterial District, District No. 1, p. 7; Find A Grave, "Theodore Wythe Bates (1815 - 1895)," Memorial #31462564, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=31462564 (accessed 7 May 2017).
